title: How to Change the Windows Taskbar Position: 2 Easy Methods

steps.title: Open Taskbar Settings.
steps.content: Open Taskbar Settings. While you cannot move the taskbar in Windows 11, you can align the text, Windows menu, and icons to appear to the left or centered. To open Taskbar Settings, right-click an empty area on the taskbar and select Taskbar settings .

steps.title: Select Taskbar behaviors on the menu.
steps.content: Select Taskbar behaviors on the menu.

steps.title: Choose Left or Center next to "Taskbar alignment."
steps.content: Choose Left or Center next to "Taskbar alignment." The taskbar will remain at the bottom of your screen, but the icons and buttons will shift to the left or in the center based on your choice.

steps.title: Right-click a blank section of the taskbar.
steps.content: Right-click a blank section of the taskbar. A menu with tools to customize the desktop will open. If you can't see the taskbar, this wikiHow guide will teach you how to get it back .

steps.title: Verify the taskbar is unlocked.
steps.content: Verify the taskbar is unlocked. Towards the bottom of the menu, you will see an option to "Lock the taskbar". Make sure this option is unchecked before proceeding to the next step. steps.title: Click the drop-down arrow on the "Taskbar location on screen" setting.
steps.content: Click the drop-down arrow on the "Taskbar location on screen" setting. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Select where you want to move the taskbar.
steps.content: Select where you want to move the taskbar. Once you select an option, the taskbar will change its position immediately. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source
